intro: Isotropis juncea, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a hairy texture, and it produces small white flowers in clusters. The roots of Isotropis juncea contain compounds that have been studied for their potential medicinal properties.
